title: Combination Sum
description: Given an array of distinct integers candidates and a target integer target, return a list of all unique combinations of candidates where the chosen numbers sum to target. You may return the combinations in any order. The same number may be chosen from candidates an unlimited number of times. Two combinations are unique if the frequency of at least one of the chosen numbers is different.
constraints: All elements of candidates are distinct.

brute-force.name: Backtracking
brute-force.description: DFS with decision to include same number again or move next.

steps.instruction: Define the function combination_sum that takes candidates and target.

steps.hint: Initialize a list to store the valid combinations.

steps.instruction: Define dfs function taking index i, current combination cur, and current total.
steps.hint: Define DFS. If total equals target, add copy of current combination to results.

steps.placeholderCode:
if i >= len(candidates) or total > target:
            return
steps.hint: Stop if index out of bounds or total exceeds target.
steps.solutionCode:
if i >= len(candidates) or total > target:
            return

steps.instruction: Include candidates[i] and recurse (stay at i).
steps.hint:
Add current candidate and recurse with same index (allowing reuse).

Example:
Target=7, Candidates=[2, 3].
Start: 0. Add 2 -> Total=2. Recurse (index 0).
Add 2 -> Total=4. Recurse (index 0).
Add 2 -> Total=6. Recurse (index 0).
Add 2 -> Total=8 (>7). Backtrack.

steps.instruction: Exclude candidates[i] and recurse (move to i + 1).
steps.hint: Backtrack (remove last element) and recurse with next index.
Start DFS from index 0 with empty list and 0 total.

optimal.name: Backtracking
optimal.description: Same as brute force, optimized by sorting.
